thread.title: Emmerdale newbie Sally Dexter reveals why Faith Dingle is REALLY back in town
thread.title_full: Emmerdale newbie Sally Dexter reveals why Faith Dingle is REALLY back in town

author: Nicola Agius
title: Emmerdale newbie Sally Dexter reveals why Faith Dingle is REALLY back in town
text:
Emmerdale newbie Sally Dexter reveals why Faith Dingle is REALLY back in town The village legend returned last week after a 13-year absence Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Who is the new mystery woman on Emmerdale? Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Emmerdale's Faith Dingle is back after 13 years away. 
And nobody is more suspicious of the village legend than her on-screen son Cain and daughter Chas. 
She reckons she's returned to the village to reunite with her family after learning her great-granddaughter Sarah has cancer. 
In fact, she's so keen to get back on good terms with the Dingles that she's donated Â£20,000 to Sarah's health fund. (Photo: ITV) 
But is she telling the truth? Read More Emmerdale viewers 'heartbroken' as Laurel Potts puts dementia husband Ashley Thomas in care home 
Sally Dexter, who plays Faith, told Digital Spy: "Faith has had a bit of a health scare herself, which has put her life into perspective. She's come to the village because she wants to see her family again - she just wants to touch roots. (Photo: ITV) 
"I think she will also do everything she can possibly think of to help Sarah. Some of the things will perhaps not be appropriate, but she does them anyway!" 
While Faith does have good intentions, Sally warned that she will be "causing havoc" in the village. (Photo: ITV) 
"She has no shame," the actress continued. "She's completely unapologetic. If she's wrong, she'll 'fess up and say she's wrong. But that doesn't mean she won't necessarily go out and do it again! She has a good heart, though. She makes mistakes but she makes them honestly." 
*Emmerdale returns to ITV tomorrow at 7pm Like us on Facebook
